attributes.short_header: Beginning Monday, June 12, the pedestrian walkway near Kendall/MIT Station (inbound) will be closed due to MIT construction.
attributes.header: Beginning Monday, June 12, the pedestrian walkway near Kendall/MIT Station (inbound) will be closed due to MIT construction.
attributes.description:
Access to the Kendall/MIT Station will remain open and accessible on the Main Street side of the station throughout this construction.
 
The pedestrian plaza between Carleton Street and Main Street in Kendall Square will be closed due to the construction of an underground garage. 
 
Customers are encouraged to utilize alternative paths to/from the station using the paths on Ames Street, Dock Street, or Wadsworth Street.

Affected routes:
Red Line

attributes.short_header: Rockport Line mid-day weekday service will be suspended between Gloucester & Rockport from Tue Aug 22nd through Fri Sep 29th, 2017
attributes.header: Rockport Line mid-day weekday service (9:30am to 3:30pm) will be suspended between Gloucester and Rockport Stations from Tuesday August 22nd through Friday September 29th, 2017 due to new rail installation
attributes.description:
Alternate shuttle bus service will be provided between Gloucester and Rockport Stations. 

Due to installation of new rail, select trains will be suspended between Gloucester and Rockport Stations in both directions on the following dates:

- Weekdays ONLY Tuesday August 22nd through Friday September 29th, 2017 

Customers should allow additional travel time anticipating delays of approximately twenty (20) minutes.

Affected stops:
Gloucester
Rockport

Affected trips (Monday through Friday):

107 (10:35 am from North Station)
112 (11:00 am from Rockport)
109 (12:00 pm from North Station)
114 (12:30 pm from Rockport)

attributes.short_header: Buses will replace Green Line D branch service between Reservoir and Riverside Stations the weekend of August 26 & 27 due to track work.
attributes.header: Buses will replace Green Line D branch service between Reservoir and Riverside Stations the weekend of August 26 & 27 due to track work.
attributes.description:
Due to necessary track work, buses will replace Riverside branch service between Reservoir and Riverside Stations on the following weekends from start to end of service:

- Saturday, August 26, 2017 and Sunday, August 27, 2017

Regular Green D branch service will resume at the start of service on the following Monday.  All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities. 
 
Shuttling the following stops:
Reservoir
Chestnut Hill
Newton Centre
Newton Highlands
Eliot
Waban
Woodland
Riverside

attributes.short_header: From September 2 through November 18, there will be no weekend Needham Line train service while Positive Train Control (PTC) is installed.
attributes.header: From September 2 through November 18, there will be no weekend Needham Line train service while Positive Train Control (PTC) is installed.
attributes.description:
A public meeting has been scheduled for Thursday, August 24, at the Needham Town Hall (1471 Highland Avenue, Needham) at 6:30 pm.

To get around on the Needham Line during construction, please utilize the following connecting bus/subway service:
- From Needham Heights, Needham Center, and Needham Junction, the Route 59 bus service connects to Newton Highlands on the Green Line D Branch and to Watertown Square. 
- From West Roxbury, Highland, Bellevue, and Roslindale Village, Bus Routes 35, 36, and 37 connect to and from Forest Hills on the Orange Line, which also serves Ruggles and Back Bay.
- Customers who typically board at Hersey Station are encouraged to travel to Needham Junction or West Roxbury Stations instead as there are no direct connecting MBTA services at Hersey.

attributes.short_header: Shuttle buses, making all stops, will replace all weekend service on the Lowell Line from Aug 5th through Oct 1st.
attributes.header: Shuttle buses, making all stops, will replace all weekend service on the Lowell Line from August 5th through October 1st due to the installation of PTC.
attributes.description:
The MBTA will install federally mandated Positive Train Control (PTC) systems along the Lowell Line to improve safety by reducing train collisions and derailments. This work will require weekend shutdowns on the entire line from August 5 through October 1. To help passengers travel between Boston and Lowell, the MBTA is running ADA accessible bus shuttles (with WiFi and restroom facilities) that will make stops at every Commuter Rail station.

Lowell bus shuttle tickets are $4 one-way, and monthly passes will be accepted.  Tickets can be purchased on-board, at the North Station Ticket Office, or at the Charlie van outside North Station on the corner of Haverhill and Causeway streets.

attributes.description: If exiting, return to the fare lobby to use North Station Elevator 912 (lobby to Causeway Street) or pass through the fare gates, walk the full length of the Green Line platform to use North Station Elevator 909 (lobby to Valenti Way). If boarding, cross Causeway Street to use North Station Elevator 912 (lobby to street) or travel one-tenth of a mile down Haverhill Street to the entrance located at the intersection of Haverhill Street and Valenti Way.

attributes.short_header: Please board all trains on the inbound platforms at Haverhill & Bradford except Trains 216 & 222
attributes.header: Please board all trains on the inbound platforms at Haverhill and Bradford except Trains 216 (1:35 pm from Haverhill) and 222 (6:09 pm from Haverhill).
attributes.description:
Due to the Merrimack River Bridge project, trains that operate between Bradford and Haverhill will only use the inbound track. Trains that are bused between Haverhill and Bradford will board on the outbound platform at Bradford for service into Boston. Note: Train 216 (1:35 pm from Haverhill) and Train 222 (6:09 pm from Haverhill) are bused from Haverhill Station to Bradford Station. The outbound platform at Bradford may be accessed via the crossing that is south (to the right when facing the tracks from the parking lot) of the mini-high platforms. Alternatively, the outbound platform can also be accessed via the sidewalk from Laurel Avenue.


Affected stops:
Bradford
Haverhill

attributes.short_header: All weekend Fairmount Line trains will be bused between Morton St. & Readville due to construction of Blue Hill Ave Station.
attributes.header: Starting 6/3, all weekend Fairmount Line trains will be bused between Morton St. and Readville in both directions due to construction of the new Blue Hill Avenue Station.
attributes.description:
Starting Saturday, June 3rd, major construction of the brand new, fully accessible Blue Hill Avenue Station on the Fairmount Line will take place on weekends and in the evening weekday hours for up to twenty-four months. 

During this time, all weekend Fairmount Line trains will be bused between Morton Street and Readville in both directions.  

A schedule will be put into effect, effective June 3rd, to account for busing, and is available on the Fairmount Line schedule page on mbta.com.

Affected stops:
Morton Street
Fairmount
Readville

attributes.short_header: Elevator 804 PARK STREET - Tremont Street to the Lobby will be reconstructed and will remain out of service until January 2018.
attributes.header: Elevator 804 PARK STREET - Tremont Street to the Lobby will be reconstructed and will remain out of service until January 2018.
attributes.description: If entering the station, cross Tremont Street to the Boston Common and use Park Street Elevator 978 to the Green Line westbound platform. Red Line platform access is available via the elevator beyond the fare gates. If exiting the station, please travel down the Winter Street Concourse toward Downtown Crossing Station, exit through the fare gates, and take Downtown Crossing Elevator 892 to the street level.

attributes.header: The following stops are temporarily closed at UMass beginning Sun Jul 30: Mt Vernon @ Paul Dever School, Mt Vernon @ South Point Drive and the UMass Boston Campus Center
attributes.description:

Temporarily Closed Stops:
Mt Vernon St @ Paul Dever School (inbound and outbound)
Mt Vernon St @ South Point Drive (inbound and outbound) 
UMass Boston Campus Center

Temporary stops at Harbor Point Blvd will be the last stop before UMass and the first stop towards Boston.

Affected routes:
8
16

This closure is scheduled to end late August or early September

attributes.short_header: Starting 6/5, the last 2 weekday outb. Fairmount Ln trains, 787 & 789 will be replaced by buses due to construction of the new Blue Hill Ave
attributes.header: Starting 6/5, the last 2 weekday outbound Fairmount Line trains, 787 (10:00 pm outbound) and 789 (11:00 pm outbound) will be replaced by buses due to construction of the new Blue Hill Avenue Station.
attributes.description:
Starting Saturday, June 3rd, major construction of the brand new, fully accessible Blue Hill Avenue Station on the Fairmount Line will take place on weekends and in the evening weekday hours for up to twenty-four months. 

During this time, the last two weeknight outbound Fairmount Line trains from South Station will be replaced with dedicated shuttle buses serving all stops between South Station and Readville.

A schedule will be put into effect, effective June 3rd, to account for busing, and is available on the Fairmount Line schedule page on mbta.com.

attributes.short_header: Access to the east entrance of North Station is available through a covered walkway. Legends Way is closed to pedestrian access.
attributes.header: Access to the east entrance of North Station is available through a covered walkway. Legends Way is closed to pedestrian access.
attributes.description:
Customers are advised that the pedestrian route for customers transferring from the Green and Orange Line exits at Causeway and Beverly St into North Station Commuter Rail will be moved slightly to accommodate ongoing construction work. 

After crossing Causeway St, pedestrians will use a protected walkway along the east side of Legends Way, directly abutting Portal Park. The walkway will include a barrier and kick-plate for blind and low vision passengers.

As an alternative, customers may consider utilizing the west exit from North Station Commuter Rail due to congestion.

attributes.short_header: Fitchburg Line service will be suspended between Porter Sq & N Station this Sat, Aug 19th, until 6 pm
attributes.service_effect: Suspension of service on Fitchburg Line
attributes.header: Fitchburg Line service will be suspended between Porter Square & North Station this Saturday, August 19th, until approximately 6 pm. Subway connections provided at Porter Square & North Station.
attributes.description:
Due to Green Line Extension construction in Somerville, Fitchburg line service will be suspended between Porter Square and North Station in both directions on the following date: 
- Saturday, August 19th, 2017 


Inbound Fitchburg Line service will terminate at Porter Square where passengers can connect with the Red Line for service to Boston. Passengers desiring outbound Fitchburg Line service from Boston must take the Red Line to Porter Square Station for Commuter Rail connection. There will be no direct connection between Porter Square and North Station. Passengers are to allow approximately thirty (30) minutes of travel time from North Station to Porter Square. Outbound trains will depart at their scheduled times from Porter Square.

The following trains will be affected:
Train 1400 (6:30 am from Wachusett)
Train 1401 (8:35 am from North Station)
Train 1402 (8:45 am from Wachusett)
Train 1403 (10:45 am from North Station)
Train 1404 (10:50 am from Wachusett)
Train 1405

attributes.short_header: Shuttle buses, making all stops, will replace all weekend service on the Newburyport/Rockport Line from July 8th through August 27th.
attributes.header: Shuttle buses, making all stops, will replace all weekend service on the Newburyport/Rockport Line from July 8th through August 27th.
attributes.description:
The MBTA will install federally mandated Positive Train Control (PTC) systems along the Newburyport/Rockport Line to improve safety by reducing train collisions and derailments. This work will require weekend shutdowns on the entire line from July 8 through August 27. To help passengers travel between Boston and the North Shore, the MBTA is running ADA accessible bus shuttles (with WiFi and restroom facilities) that will make stops at every Commuter Rail station. 

During this time, the special weekend fare will be $10 roundtrip, and Zone 3 or higher monthly passes will be accepted. Additionally, parking will be free at all stations north of Beverly Depot.

attributes.short_header: On Sat, 8/19, & Sun, 8/20, all Fairmount Line trains will be bused between Readville & S. Station due to the replacement of an Amtrak switch
attributes.header: On Saturday, 8/19, and Sunday, 8/20, all Fairmount Line trains will be bused between Readville and South Station to accommodate the replacement of an Amtrak switch.
attributes.description:
Shuttle buses will make stops at all stations between Readville and South Station in both directions.

During this period, the MBTA will also take advantage of the suspension of service to accomplish some Positive Train Control (PTC) installations along the line.

Buses will pick up and drop off at the following locations:

South Station - On Atlantic Avenue at Summer Street
Newmarket - Newmarket Square at Massachusetts Avenue (#10 bus stop)
Uphams Corner - On Dudley Street (#15/#41 bus stop)
Four Corners / Geneva - On Washington Street (#23 bus stop)
Talbot Ave - On Talbot Avenue (#22/#45 bus stops)
Morton St - In the parking lot adjacent to the inbound (track #2) platform
Fairmount - On Fairmount Ave at the top of the ramps from the platform
Readville - In the station parking lot adjacent to the platform (track #4) or take a Franklin Line train (on track #5)
